original_text:
**INSTITUTION
General Internal Medicine
Discharge Summary
PATIENT NAME :
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
ACCOUNT # :
**ID-NUM
ATTENDING :
**NAME[YYY]
**NAME[ZZZ]
ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[Dec 16 2007] 00:01:00
DISCHARGE DATE :
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES :
1. Syncope .
2. Transient ischemic attack .
3. Left ventricular dysfunction .
4. Hypertension .
5. Neuropathy in lower extremities .
6. Status post pacemaker placement .
7. Hypothyroidism .
The patient is an **AGE[in 80s]- year - old female who was admitted with a history of passing out .
She also has recurrent dizziness .
The patient was admitted with a diagnosis of syncope ; rule out TIA , rule out cardiac arrhythmia .
CBC and BMP were unremarkable .
Troponin was unremarkable .
Chest x-ray did not reveal any acute disease .
Head CAT scan did not reveal any acute CVA .
The patient was admitted for further investigations .
Cardiology evaluation was called .
Pacemaker was checked and adjusted .
The patient had a carotid Doppler done which revealed a right - sided 40% and left - sided 41% to 59% block .
EEG was unremarkable .
Echocardiogram did not reveal any __________ except some mild mitral stenosis and some mild LV dysfunction .
The patient continued to improve .
There were no more episodes of dizziness or syncope .
Started her on p.o. Coumadin and subcutaneous Lovenox .
The patient had a CT angiogram of the carotid , which revealed right ICA has 30% block and left ICA only 40% block .
The patient was also seen by a neurologist , Dr. __________ .
The patient is clinically stable .
INR was 1.1 today .
We will discharge the patient home with subcu Lovenox and Coumadin .
Examination finding at the time of discharge as per my progress note .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. Aspirin 325 mg daily .
2. Lipitor 20 mg daily .
3. Digoxin 0.125 daily .
4. Lovenox 90 mg subcu b.i.d. until INR is more than 2 .
5. Synthroid 37.5 mcg daily .
6. Lyrica 25 by mouth b.i.d.
7. Coumadin 3 mg daily .
We will discontinue aspirin once the INR is 2 .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS :
Take medications regularly .
__________ on Monday .
PT / OT , increase activity , and follow up in office in 7 to 10 days .
_____________________________________
**NAME[YYY]
**NAME[ZZZ]
DICTATED BY :
**NAME[YYY M. ZZZ] , M.D.
**INITIALS
D :
**DATE[Dec 19 2007] 09:35:28
